hotspots.label: Meerkat Animal
hotspots.fact: This meerkat is a living organism that needs food, water, and shelter to survive, just like all animals do. Meerkats live together in groups called mobs and help each other stay safe and find food in their desert habitat. This is called **adaptation** â€” special traits that help animals survive in their environment, like the meerkat's ability to stand on its back legs to watch for danger.

vocabulary.definition: A special body part or behavior that helps an animal survive and thrive in its home.

hotspots.label: Green Plants
hotspots.fact: These green plants are living organisms that make their own food using sunlight, water, and air through a process called photosynthesis. Plants are an important part of the ecosystem because they provide food and oxygen for animals like the meerkat to survive. Without plants, many animals would have no food or shelter.

vocabulary.definition: The process plants use to turn sunlight, water, and air into food and oxygen.

hotspots.label: White Flowers
hotspots.fact: These white flowers are part of a plant's life cycle and help make seeds for new plants to grow. Flowers attract insects and animals that help with **pollination**, which is when pollen moves from one flower to another so the plant can make seeds. This is an important job that helps keep ecosystems healthy and balanced.

vocabulary.definition: When pollen is carried from one flower to another, usually by insects or animals, so plants can make seeds.

hotspots.label: Garden Habitat
hotspots.fact: This garden is a small ecosystem where different living things interact with each other and their environment. The soil, rocks, plants, and animals all work together in this habitat to create a balanced community. When we observe nature like this, we can see how all organisms depend on each other to survive.

vocabulary.definition: A community of living things and the non-living environment they live in, all working together.
